intro: Cenocline acutiloba, commonly known as the sharp-lobed cenocline, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped with sharp lobes, and it produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Cenocline acutiloba is often found in high-altitude environments, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
